title: The uses of observation: combining problem structuring methods and ethnography
abstract:
In this paper, we examine conceptual and practical aspects of carrying out cross-disciplinary, multi-method,\ud
interventions that bring together methods from operational research (OR) with ethnographic tools drawn\ud
from sociology and anthropology. We note that such methodological hybridization is not a new development,\ud
although historically, the role of ethnography in OR has not always been explicit in written accounts. We\ud
illustrate such usage by means of a number of concrete examples. We then describe recent work in which we\ud
have successfully combined problem structuring methods with ethnographic investigations in order to address\ud
disparate problem issues
